column14: A successful achievement after effort.
column15: Winning the spelling contest was a great accomplishment for me as a child.

column14: An effort to do something difficult.
column15: My first attempt at riding a bike ended with me falling over.

column14: A significant achievement after overcoming a challenge.
column15: Finally learning how to swim was a breakthrough moment in my childhood.

column14: Something difficult that requires effort to overcome.
column15: Climbing that tree was a real challenge for my younger self.

column14: A strong will to keep going despite difficulties.
column15: My determination to learn how to ride a bike helped me succeed.

column14: Feeling discouraged after failure.
column15: I felt disheartened when I kept falling off the skateboard.

column14: Support or motivation given to someone.
column15: My dad's encouragement helped me keep trying despite the difficulties.

column14: Extremely exciting and thrilling.
column15: The first time I jumped into the pool on my own was an exhilarating experience.

column14: Showing no fear in facing challenges.
column15: My younger brother was fearless when trying new things, unlike me.

column14: The feeling of being annoyed or upset due to failure.
column15: After many failed attempts, frustration started to take over.

column14: Courage and perseverance in achieving something.
column15: It took a lot of grit to keep trying until I finally succeeded.

column14: A pause or doubt before doing something.
column15: There was a moment of hesitation before I finally let go of my dad’s hand.

column14: Complete skill or understanding of something.
column15: After weeks of practice, I finally achieved mastery in rollerblading.

column14: Worth remembering due to significance or impact.
column15: That day remains one of the most memorable moments of my childhood.

column14: To successfully deal with a problem or challenge.
column15: I had to overcome my fear of heights before jumping off the diving board.

column14: Continued effort despite difficulties.
column15: Through perseverance, I finally learned to whistle.

column14: Feeling deep satisfaction for an achievement.
column15: I felt incredibly proud when I managed to tie my shoelaces by myself.

column14: Feeling relaxed after overcoming a difficult situation.
column15: I was relieved when I finally managed to ride my bike without falling.

column14: A difficulty or problem that delays progress.
column15: Failing my first swimming lesson was just a minor setback.

column14: A great success or victory.
column15: My first solo piano recital was a personal triumph.

column14: Lacking stability or balance.
column15: My steps were unsteady when I first tried to skate.

column14: To move unsteadily from side to side.
column15: My bike started to wobble before I gained full control.
